remarks: Any vertex in a friendship graph (with more than one vertex - then, actually, the graph must have at least three vertices, because otherwise, it would not be a friendship graph) has at least degree 2, see remark 3 in [MertziosUnger] p. 153 (after Proposition 1):  "It follows that deg(v) >= 2 for every node v of a friendship graph".  (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 21-Dec-2017.)
statement: vdgfrgragt2 $p |- ( ( V FriendGrph E /\ N e. V ) -> ( 1 < ( # ` V ) -> 2 <_ ( ( V VDeg E ) ` N ) ) ) $.
